title: Urlbar shows searches from history
content:
Hello, with the newest updates, when I type something in the urlbar for Google Search it shows historical entries instead of Google suggestions. Even though browser.urlbar.maxHistoricalSearchSuggestions is set to 0 and history searches are off in the settings etc. Can you show me a way to restore the search? See attachment for better understanding. (at least I hope)

Clearing cache doesnt help, because it also deletes form entries and doesnt prevent Firefox from storing my historical searches.

Thank you kind regards
creator: shago3

title: youtube
content:
привет столкнулся с такой проблемой: после переустановки операционной системы windows 10 ( менял компьютерное железо) и установки последней версии firefox не могу нормально пользоваться сайтом YOUTUBE постоянно слетает вход в аккаунт и из за этого нет доступа к подпискам и не могу оставлять комментарии. при попытке входа сайт выдает ошибку 405, либо отображаются подписки но нет входа.куки удалять пробовал. на встроенном в систему браузере еджи все работает нормально

Hello, I encountered such a problem: after reinstalling the windows 10 operating system (changing the computer hardware) and installing the latest version of firefox, I cannot normally use the YOUTUBE site, the login to my account constantly flies and because of this there is no access to subscriptions and I can not leave comments. when trying to log in, the site gives an error 405, or subscriptions are displayed but there is no login. I tried to delete cookies. everything works fine on the browser built into the system
creator: serginsibiria

title: I can't log in to coinbase
content: recently my firefox browser lost my password to coinbase, and sent incorrect information to coinbase that locked my account out. This is not a myth, it actually happened. It took me well over a week to get my account unlocked. I lost a week of trading because of this apparently well known glitch on Firefox. Now, I can't even load or log in to coinbase from Firefox. Why????
creator: bekglm1

title: Add-ons not display on toolbar
content:
Hi. I believe my Firefox browser was updated - it now is version 82.0.2 and I now have a folder labelled Old Firefox Data on my desktop. The update lost all of my settings and add-ons. So, I changed the settings back to the former state. And, I downloaded / installed the add-ons, which show as "Enabled" . But, the add-ons don't appear on the toolbar.

If I go to Options and set Enhance Tracking Protection to Standard and History to Remember History, then I can 1) see the add-ons in the Customize section and 2) successful place the add-ons on the toolbar. But, after I vhange Enhanced Tracking Protection back to Strict and History to Never Remember, then the add-ons again disappear from the toolbar.

Can you please advise me of the fix to this problem.

Thanks much
creator: rnewell.m1

title: Flickering menu options when right-clicking in toolbar folders
content:
Hi, I'm running FF82.0.2 on a Mac 10.14.6. There seems to be a bug in the folders in FF's bookmark toolbar. When I click on any toolbar folder and then right-click a url within that folder, I find that all the options (Open, Open in a New Tab, Open in a New Window, New Bookmark etc) start flickering when I run the cursor over them. They do not stay a solid blue as expected. This happens only with the urls nestled within any particular folder. Right-clicking a folder or url directly from the toolbar works properly, ie; they remain a solid blue and only change as I scroll through each option.

Things I've tried w/out success ... Restarting the browser with addons disabled. Refreshing the browser. Tried a different mouse. A complete uninstall/reinstall of FF with only the bookmarks.js file exported/imported.

I thought the bookmarks.js file might have been corrupted so I went into the new Profiles folder and removed 'bookmarkbackups' and 'places.sqlite'. After restarting all bookmarks were gone (as expected) so I created a new toolbar folder with 3 or 4 urls and tried once more, but again the same flickering problem. Not sure what else to do. Does anybody know what might be causing this and how I could fix it? I've added a screenshot taken a from a screen recording. Obviously it doesn't show the flickering but it might help to give a clearer picture. Thanks
creator: Tt108

title: How do I have gmail open automatically when Firefox starts?
content:
For as long as I can remember, my gmail used to automatically open the Inbox when I started Firefox. To do that, the Options>Home>Homepage and new windows>Custom URLs included the address of the gmail Inbox, i.e. https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#inbox.

However, since Firefox v82.0 installed, I cannot get gmail to open automatically on Firefox startup. Even time, I am forced to say I want to sign in and then enter user name and password (obviously I have those saved so i just have to accept their entry but that's not the point).

This is already annoying. However, as I live in a Spanish-speaking country, gmail automatically defaults to Spanish and I have to reset it, each time, to English. If the inbox opened as it used to do, it would presumably not default to Spanish ("helpful" Google service) as it never used to to that.

Firefox has my gmail username and password saved so what am I doing wrong? Why has this changed from earlier Firefox versions and I how do I get around whatever is forcing this?
creator: paulindr

title: How do I disentagle my personal and work Firefox
content:
Is there any way to disentangle my work and personal info (bookmarks, etc.) now that they're [inadvertently] entangled!? Personal computer has my work bookmarks, etc. and work computer has my many more personal bookmarks, etc.

Logging out of my personal acct on work laptop doesn't change anything.
creator: kharndt

title: Printing using different printers crosses user preference paper sizes
content:
I've been seeing an issue where one of my users has 2 types of printers installed that use different size paper, where printing to the main printer works fine, until they print to the label printer. Once that happens the user.prefs show the label printer paper height and width for the main laserjet printer, until manually edited. Once corrected it seems to work fine, until the label printer is used again.

The issue appeared over the weekend, which I believe is when the new update to FireFox was released.

title: Tabs on bottom again
content:
I am sure you are tired of hearing about this topic, but it has reached a new level in my case. While I was away from home for a couple of months, I bought a laptop and installed Firefox, and immediately got the .chrome set up to put the tabs where they belong. No problem. I got home and made the "mistake" of updating Firefox on my desktop PC. Shouldn't be an issue; just e-mail myself the .chrome files from my laptop and drop them in the same location, right?

No.

So what is the deal? Did the previous version use a different location that I need to find and delete first? Do I need to say additional Hail Marys?

Both PCs are running the same Windows version (10), with the same Firefox version (82.whatever), with the same .chrome in the same file location on the respective hard drives. In fact, both hard drives are M.2 SSD. So what did I do wrong (besides allowing the update)?
creator: cionaoith
